verses.text: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits, As the grapegleanings of the vintage: \add There is\add* no cluster to eat: My soul desired the firstripe fruit.
The good \add man\add* is perished out of the earth: And \add there is\add* none upright among men: They all lie in wait for blood; They hunt every man his brother \add with\add* a net.

That \add they\add* may do evil with both hands earnestly, The prince asketh, and the judge \add asketh\add* for a reward; And the great \add man\add*, he uttereth his mischievous desire: So they wrap it up.

The best of them \add is\add* as a brier: The \add most\add* upright \add is sharper\add* than a thorn hedge: The day of thy watchmen \add and\add* thy visitation cometh; Now shall be their perplexity.
Trust ye not in a friend, Put ye not confidence in a guide: Keep the doors of thy mouth from her that lieth in thy bosom.
For the son dishonoureth the father, The daughter riseth up against her mother, The daughter in law against her mother in law; A manâ€™s enemies \add are\add* the men of his own house.
Therefore I will look unto the \sc Lord\sc*; I will wait for the God of my salvation: My God will hear me.
Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: When I fall, I shall arise; When I sit in darkness, the \sc Lord\sc* \add shall be\add* a light unto me.

I will bear the indignation of the \sc Lord\sc*, because I have sinned against him, Until he plead my cause, and execute judgment for me: He will bring me forth to the light, \add and\add* I shall behold his righteousness.

Then she \add that is\add* mine enemy shall see \add it\add*, and shame shall cover her Which said unto me, Where is the \sc Lord\sc* thy God? Mine eyes shall behold her: Now shall she be trodden down as the mire of the streets.
\add In\add* the day that thy walls are \add to be\add* built, \add In\add* that day shall the decree be far removed.

\add In\add* that day \add also\add* he shall come even to thee From Assyria, and \add from\add* the fortified cities, And from the fortress even to the river, And from sea \add to\add* sea, and \add from\add* mountain \add to\add* mountain.
Notwithstanding the land shall be desolate because of them that dwell therein, For the fruit of their doings.

Feed thy people with thy rod, the flock of thine heritage, Which dwell solitarily \add in\add* the wood, in the midst of Carmel: Let them feed \add in\add* Bashan and Gilead, as \add in\add* the days of old.
According to the days of thy coming out of the land of Egypt Will I shew unto him marvellous \add things\add*.
The nations shall see and be confounded at all their might: They shall lay \add their\add* hand upon \add their\add* mouth, their ears shall be deaf.
They shall lick the dust like a serpent, They shall move out of their holes like worms of the earth: They shall be afraid of the \sc Lord\sc* our God, And shall fear because of thee.
Who \add is\add* a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, And passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage? He retaineth not his anger for ever, Because he delighteth in mercy.
He will turn again, he will have compassion upon us; He will subdue our iniquities; And thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.
Thou wilt perform the truth to Jacob, \add and\add* the mercy to Abraham, Which thou hast sworn unto our fathers from the days of old.
